channel.title: I'm making a website/forums but I have some questions
channel.description: So, I'm making a website based on gaming and it's going to be something like gamesville.com (That's an example, and yes I know the domain name is taken!) and I'm going to have a SMF section so it will be like something.com/smf/ but when I checked the SMF requirements for the downloadable SMF V1.1.10, it said for a minimum requirement, to have a webserver thing such as Apache and IIS. That's where I need help. What's a webserver and why do I need it? If I buy a domain using GoDaddy do I need a webserver? Also, this is a question focusing on SMF, what files do I upload to my website once I buy it? And I have one last question, where can I download a file that lets you open PHP Files and view them fine instead of viewing PHP files in Notepad and seeing all of the code in 10 everlasting lines?

item.title: I'm making a website/forums but I have some questions
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:3, topic:309018”]So what’s wrong with IIS?[/quote]It’s stupid. Just register on a web host like ulmb, 00webhost, godaddy, etc. If you purchase your own webserver (which I doubt you’ll follow through with) you’ll have to pay 11usd monthly.

Web Hosts have their own server with databases always compatible with MySQL & Apache integration. You just have to upload SMF or whatever forum you plan on using to your main directory. Btw, you don’t have to keep the folder named /smf, you can change it to whatever you like as long as you change the folder name.

ie. yourdomain.com/smf —> yourdomain.com/forum

Read full topic
item.source: I'm making a website/forums but I have some questions

item.title: I'm making a website/forums but I have some questions
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

r0ckstar96:

So what’s wrong with IIS?

Microsoft made it and everything made by Microsoft sucks (especially IIS).

Read full topic

item.title: I'm making a website/forums but I have some questions
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

A webserver hosts your files from a directory so you can view them in a web-browser. Apache is the most common webserver however you can also download lighthtpp and if your an idiot you can get IIS (Its on Windows XP pro/server)

You can only run a webserver on a host. GoDaddy provides both domains and hosting. You can buy unlimited hosting on a linux node running a compatible webserver for $15/mo. But then you also must get the domain itself for $11/year

Read full topic
item.source: I'm making a website/forums but I have some questions
